methods.name: eth_subscribe
methods.summary: Subscribes to specific Ethereum events, returning a subscription ID used to receive notifications.
methods.description: The eth_subscribe method allows clients to subscribe to specific events on the Ethereum network, such as new blocks, new pending transactions, or changes in the state of an account. When an event occurs, a notification is sent to the client with the corresponding data. To stop receiving notifications, the client can unsubscribe using the eth_unsubscribe method.

schema.title: subscriptionType
schema.description: The type of subscription to create. Must be one of:`newHeads`: new block headers - `logs`: logs matching a filter object - `newPendingTransactions`: new pending transactions - `syncing`: changes in syncing status

schema.title: filterOptions
schema.description: An optional object containing filter options specific to the subscription type. Only applicable for 'logs' subscription type.

address.description: A single address or an array of addresses to filter the logs by. Optional.

topics.description: An array of topics to filter the logs by.

result.name: subscriptionId
result.description: A unique subscription ID that can be used to unsubscribe or identify incoming notifications.

methods.name: eth_unsubscribe
methods.summary: Unsubscribes from a specific Ethereum event, using the subscription ID provided by eth_subscribe.
methods.description: The eth_unsubscribe method allows clients to unsubscribe from specific events on the Ethereum network, to which they have previously subscribed using the eth_subscribe method. The client needs to provide the subscription ID obtained from eth_subscribe to stop receiving notifications for the corresponding event.

schema.description: The unique subscription ID obtained from the eth_subscribe method, used to identify the subscription to be unsubscribed.

result.name: unsubscribed
result.description: A boolean value indicating whether the unsubscription was successful.

methods.name: wallet_addEthereumChain
methods.summary: Adds an Ethereum chain to the wallet.
methods.description: Creates a confirmation asking the user to add the specified chain to the wallet application. The caller must specify a chain ID and some chain metadata. The wallet application may refuse or accept the request. `null` is returned if the chain is added, and an error otherwise. Introduced by [EIP 3085](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3085).

errors.message: Expected null or array with at least one valid string HTTPS URL 'blockExplorerUrl'. Received: ${blockExplorerUrls}

Expected 0x-prefixed, unpadded, non-zero hexadecimal string 'chainId'. Received:
${chainId}

Invalid chain ID "${_chainId}": numerical value greater than max safe value. Received:
${chainId}
May not specify default MetaMask chain.

nativeCurrency.symbol does not match currency symbol for a network the user already has added with the same chainId. Received:
${ticker}

methods.name: wallet_switchEthereumChain
methods.summary: Switches the wallet's active Ethereum chain.
methods.description: Requests that the wallet switches its active Ethereum chain. Introduced by [EIP 3326](https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-3326-wallet-switchethereumchain).

chainId.description: MUST specify the integer ID of the chain as a hexadecimal string, per the eth_chainId Ethereum RPC method.

errors.message: Unrecognized chain ID. Try adding the chain using `wallet_addEthereumChain` first.

methods.name: wallet_requestPermissions
methods.summary: Requests additional permissions.
methods.description: Requests additional permissions from the user. Introduced by [EIP-2255](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2255).

methods.name: wallet_getPermissions
methods.summary: Gets the user's permissions.
methods.description: Gets the user's permissions. Introduced by [EIP-2255](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2255).

methods.name: wallet_registerOnboarding
methods.summary: Redirects the user back to the site after onboarding.
methods.description: Registers the requesting site with MetaMask as the initiator of onboarding, enabling MetaMask to redirect the user back to the site after onboarding. Returns a promise that resolves to `true`, or rejects if there's an error. Instead of calling this method directly, you should use the [`@metamask/onboarding`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-onboarding) library.

result.name: RegisterOnboardingResult
result.description: `true` if the request was successful, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: wallet_watchAsset
methods.summary: Tracks a token in MetaMask.
methods.description: Requests that the user track the specified token in MetaMask. Returns a boolean indicating if the token was successfully added. Once added, the token is indistinguishable from those added using legacy methods, such as a centralized registry. Introduced by [EIP-747](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-747). Currently support for ERC721 and ERC1155 tokens is limited to the extension (not on mobile) and is considered experimental. See [MIP-1](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/MIPs/mip-1.md) and [MIP proposal lifecycle](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/PROCESS-GUIDE.md#proposal-lifecycle) for more information.

schema.description: Supports ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC-1155 tokens. Currently support for ERC721 and ERC1155 tokens is limited to the extension (not on mobile) and is considered experimental. See [MIP-1](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/MIPs/mip-1.md) and [MIP proposal lifecycle](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/PROCESS-GUIDE.md#proposal-lifecycle) for more information.

address.description: The address of the token contract.

symbol.description: A ticker symbol or shorthand, up to 11 characters (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

decimals.description: The number of token decimals (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

image.description: A string URL of the token logo (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

tokenId.description: The unique identifier of the NFT (required for ERC-721 and ERC-1155 tokens).

errors.message: Must specify address, symbol, and decimals.
Both address and tokenId are required
Suggested NFT is not owned by the selected account.
Suggested NFT of type ${standard} does not match received type ${type}
Unable to verify ownership. Possibly because the standard is not supported or the user's currently selected network does not match the chain of the asset in question.

result.name: WatchAssetResult
result.description: `true` if the token was added, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: eth_decrypt
methods.summary: Decrypts an encrypted message.
methods.description: Requests that MetaMask decrypt the specified encrypted message. The message must have been encrypted using the public encryption key of the specified Ethereum address. Returns a promise that resolves to the decrypted message, or rejects if the decryption attempt fails.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the Ethereum account that can decrypt the message.

methods.name: eth_getEncryptionPublicKey
methods.summary: Gets a public key used for encryption.
methods.description: Requests that the user share their public encryption key. Returns a public encryption key, or rejects if the user denies the request. The public key is computed from entropy associated with the specified user account, using the NaCl implementation of the `X25519_XSalsa20_Poly1305` algorithm.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the Ethereum account that can decrypt the message.

methods.name: eth_requestAccounts
methods.description: Requests that the user provide an Ethereum address to be identified by. This method is specified by [EIP-1102](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1102). Internally, this method calls `wallet_requestPermissions` for permission to call `eth_accounts`.
methods.summary: Requests that the user provide an Ethereum address.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.description: Returns a list of addresses for the accounts owned by the user.
methods.summary: Gets a list of addresses for the user's accounts.

methods.name: eth_signTypedData_v4
methods.summary: Presents a structured data message for the user to sign.
methods.description: Presents a data message for the user to sign in a structured and readable format and returns the signed response. Introduced By [EIP-712](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712).

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the requested signing account.

methods.name: personal_sign
methods.summary: Presents a plain text signature challenge to the user.
methods.description: Presents a plain text signature challenge to the user and returns the signed response. Equivalent to `eth_sign` on some other wallets, and prepends a safe prefix to the signed message to prevent the challenge tricking users into signing a financial transaction. This method requires that the user has granted permission to interact with their account first, so make sure to call `eth_requestAccounts` first.

params.name: Challenge
params.description: A hex-encoded UTF-8 string to present to the user. See how to encode a string like this in the [`browser-string-hexer`](https://github.com/danfinlay/browser-string-hexer) module.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the requested signing account.

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.description: Creates a new wallet confirmation to make an ethereum transaction from the user's account. This method requires that the user has granted permission to interact with their account first, so make sure to call `eth_requestAccounts` or `wallet_requestPermissions` first.
methods.summary: Initiates a new transaction.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: The transaction object to sign and send.

schema.title: Transaction
schema.description: The parameters to customize a transaction. If a `to` address is not provided. It will be assumed that the transaction is a contract creation transaction, and the `data` field of the transaction will be used as the contract initialization code. `gasPrice` cannot be used together with `maxPriorityFeePerGas` and `maxFeePerGas`.

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei. Used in pre-1559 transactions.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei. Used in 1559 transactions.

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei. Used in 1559 transactions.

result.name: TransactionHash
result.description: The transaction hash of the sent transaction.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: Returns the chain ID of the current network.

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Returns the client coinbase address.

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

methods.name: eth_feeHistory
methods.summary: Transaction fee history
methods.description: Returns transaction base fee per gas and effective priority fee per gas for the requested/supported block range.

params.name: blockCount
params.description: Requested range of blocks. Clients will return less than the requested range if not all blocks are available.

params.name: newestBlock
params.description: Highest block of the requested range.

params.name: rewardPercentiles
params.description: A monotonically increasing list of percentile values. For each block in the requested range, the transactions will be sorted in ascending order by effective tip per gas and the coresponding effective tip for the percentile will be determined, accounting for gas consumed.

result.name: feeHistoryResult
result.description: Fee history for the returned block range. This can be a subsection of the requested range if not all blocks are available.

oldestBlock.title: oldestBlock
oldestBlock.description: Lowest number block of returned range.

baseFeePerGas.title: baseFeePerGasArray
baseFeePerGas.description: An array of block base fees per gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-1559 blocks.

gasUsedRatio.title: gasUsedRatio
gasUsedRatio.description: An array of block gas used ratios. These are calculated as the ratio of gasUsed and gasLimit.

reward.title: rewardArray
reward.description: A two-dimensional array of effective priority fees per gas at the requested block percentiles.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: An array of effective priority fee per gas data points from a single block. All zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: A given percentile sample of effective priority fees per gas from a single block in ascending order, weighted by gas used. Zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei.

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary: Returns the balance of the account of given address.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by number.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: Returns code at a given address.

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary: Polling method for a filter, which returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.summary: Returns the merkle proof for a given account and optionally some storage keys.

methods.name: eth_getStorageAt
methods.summary: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block number and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByHash
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionCount
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

methods.name: eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas
methods.summary: Returns the current maxPriorityFeePerGas per gas in wei.

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives.

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Submits a raw transaction.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary: Uninstalls a filter with given id.

EIP712Domain.description: An array specifying one or more of the following domain separator values: 1) 'name' - The user-readable name of signing domain, i.e., the name of the dapp or the protocol. 2) 'version' - The current major version of the signing domain. 3) 'chainId' - The EIP-155 chain ID. 4) 'verifyingContract' - The address of the contract that will verify the signature. 5) 'salt' - A disambiguating salt for the protocol.

domain.description: Contains the domain separator values specified in the EIP712Domain type.

chainId.description: MUST specify the integer ID of the chain as a hexadecimal string, per the eth_chainId Ethereum RPC method. The wallet SHOULD compare the specified chain ID value with the eth_chainId return value from the endpoint. If these values aren't identical, the wallet MUST reject the request.

blockExplorerUrls.description: If provided, MUST specify one or more URLs pointing to block explorer sites for the chain.

chainName.description: If provided, MUST specify a human-readable name for the chain.

iconUrls.description: If provided, MUST specify one or more URLs pointing to reasonably sized images that can be used to visually identify the chain.

NativeCurrency.title: NativeCurrency
NativeCurrency.description: If provided, MUST describe the native currency of the chain using the name, symbol, and decimals fields.

id.description: Every capability document, except for the target, MUST have an associated ID.

@context.description: When two people communicate with one another, the conversation takes place in a shared environment, typically called 'the context of the conversation.' This shared context allows the individuals to use shortcut terms, such as the first name of a mutual friend, to communicate more quickly without losing accuracy. A context in JSON-LD works the same way: it allows two applications to use shortcut terms to communicate more efficiently without losing accuracy.

invoker.description: Links to one or more instances of cryptographic material (such as public keys) being granted authority to use this capability.

caveats.description: Every capability document MAY add restrictions on the way the capability may be used by adding to the caveat property. Capabilities inherit the restrictions from all caveat properties of their parents, and MAY add new caveats in addition to those of their parents.

BlockTag.title: Block tag
BlockTag.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

BlockNumberOrTagOrHash.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

oneOf.title: Not syncing
oneOf.description: Should always return false if not syncing.

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the senders account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The effective gas price paid by the sender in wei. For transactions not yet included in a block, this value should be set equal to the max fee per gas. This field is DEPRECATED, please transition to using effectiveGasPrice in the receipt object going forward.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

yParity.title: yParity
yParity.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

v.title: v
v.description: For backwards compatibility, `v` is optionally provided as an alternative to `yParity`. This field is DEPRECATED and all use of it should migrate to `yParity`.

yParity.title: yParity
yParity.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

v.title: v
v.description: For backwards compatibility, `v` is optionally provided as an alternative to `yParity`. This field is DEPRECATED and all use of it should migrate to `yParity`.

GenericTransaction.title: Transaction object generic to all types

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

validatorIndex.title: index of validator that generated withdrawal

latestValidHash.title: The hash of the most recent valid block

status.description: Set of possible values is restricted to VALID, INVALID, SYNCING

PayloadStatusNoInvalidBlockHash.title: Payload status object deprecating INVALID_BLOCK_HASH status

Restricted.name: Restricted
Restricted.description: Restricted methods. If a method is restricted, the caller must have the corresponding permission via `wallet_requestPermissions` in order to call it.
